title: Methods Journal
text:
Essays and case studies on modeling, analysis, and real-world statistical kludges.
See Posts for all entries.

title: About
text:
This is a living archive of statistical methods, judgment calls, and practical modeling work.
I don’t always follow the book. I follow the structure of the problem.
I’m a data scientist with 9 years of experience in the pharmaceutical, logistics, medical, and educational fields. I thrive on big, underspecified problems: projects no one knows how to start, let alone finish. When I don’t have the silver bullet, give me a few weeks and I’ll crack the thing open, build the scaffolding, and deliver something clear, credible, and useful. I make methods behave in the wild, especially when the data’s weird, the goalposts move, and there’s no established best practice—just judgment.
I don’t just analyze data, I create direction from ambiguity, and work to make statistical decisions legible to people. If the problem’s weird and the expectations unclear then I’m probably your best shot.

title: Handling Delta Probabilities in GAMM Analysis
text:
Handling Delta Probabilities in GAMM Analysis
Sometimes you’re forced to compare groups without a true control condition, and stakeholders expect traditional ANOVA-style outputs. Here’s one way I handled it using weighted GAMMs and delta-probability contrasts, under heavy structural constraints.
(This is a sample post. Replace this with your real essays.)
